items.name: Intake Nurse
items.description: First point of contact for arriving patients. Responsible for rapid initial data capture (name, DOB, chief complaint) at the Intake Desk. Must process patients quickly, especially in urgent situations.
responsibilities: Capture initial patient information (name, DOB, gender, chief complaint, allergies)
Create 'Intake Complete' state for patients
Mark patients as LWBS (Left Without Being Seen) when they leave
Handle emergency trauma alerts via bypass button
Operate touchscreen/keyboard interface efficiently while wearing gloves
goals: Process patients in under 30 seconds for urgent cases
Minimize typing while maintaining data accuracy
items.environment: Fast-paced, high-stress, often wearing gloves or with sanitized hands

items.name: Triage Nurse (Head Nurse)
items.description: Responsible for taking patient vitals, assigning initial ESI scores, and preparing patients for doctor evaluation. Coordinates workflow between intake and doctor evaluation.
responsibilities: Take patient vitals (BP, temperature, O2, heart rate)
Assign initial ESI level (1-5)
Add clinical notes for doctor review (behavioral observations, concerns)
Create 'Triage In-Progress' state
Move patients through triage process efficiently
Act as doctor proxy in emergency situations
goals: Provide accurate clinical context to doctors
Use system without training for float staff
items.environment: Clinical setting, wearing gloves, sanitized hands, works day and night shifts

items.name: Triage Doctor
items.description: Emergency physician responsible for evaluating triaged patients, assigning wait time slots based on clinical judgment, and managing patient flow through the ER.
responsibilities: Review patient vitals and chief complaints
Manually assign wait time slots (Immediate, 30min, 60min, 120min, Rest)
Use clinical judgment to prioritize patients
Monitor patient wait times via dashboard alerts
Perform bulk updates when beds become available
Flag patients for security when needed
Re-categorize patients based on changing conditions
goals: Maintain clinical control over patient prioritization
Quickly adjust patient flow as conditions change
Identify escalating patient conditions via visual alerts
Work efficiently on both desktop and tablet (Surface)
items.environment: High-pressure clinical environment, mobile between triage and trauma bays, uses tablet and desktop

items.name: IT Manager / Operations
items.description: Responsible for infrastructure, deployment, security, and system reliability. Manages on-premise infrastructure and ensures compliance with security policies.
responsibilities: Manage on-premise VM infrastructure (Ubuntu 22.04, 4 vCPUs, 16GB RAM)
Configure network VLANs and firewall rules
Handle SSL/TLS certificate management (self-signed for pilot)
Approve vendor access (2-week process)
Perform manual deployments via Docker Compose
Configure LDAP/Active Directory integration
Manage hourly VM snapshots for backup
Enforce 15-minute idle timeout policy
goals: Ensure system remains operational during internet outages

items.name: Compliance Officer (GDPR/HIPAA Lead)
items.description: Ensures system complies with GDPR, HIPAA, and patient privacy regulations. Defines privacy constraints and data retention policies.
responsibilities: Enforce GDPR and HIPAA compliance (no names on public display)
Define patient ID format (Initials + Day, under 8 characters)
Approve status message enums for public display
Define data retention policies (30 days logs, 24-hour patient data deletion)
Review audit logging and anonymization practices
Handle collision resolution for patient IDs
goals: Enable auditing while protecting patient privacy

items.name: Patient
items.description: Emergency room patient waiting for triage and treatment. Experiences anxiety, pain, and uncertainty during wait times.
responsibilities: Check in at Intake Desk
Wait in waiting room
Monitor public display for their ID and wait time
Recognize their anonymized ID (Initials + Day format)
items.environment: Waiting room, potentially in pain or distress, with family members

items.name: Patient Rights Representative
items.description: Advocate for patient experience, comfort, and communication. Ensures the system treats patients humanely and reduces anxiety.
responsibilities: Define patient-friendly display formats
Advocate for humanized identification methods
Specify visual feedback requirements (blinking, highlighting)
Define status messages that reduce patient anxiety
Ensure family members can track patient progress
Balance privacy with patient reassurance
goals: Reduce patient anxiety and feeling of being 'cattle'
items.environment: Patient advocacy office, waiting room observation

items.name: Float Nurse / Temporary Staff
items.description: Temporary or substitute nursing staff who cover shifts during vacations, sick days, or high-volume periods. Limited familiarity with systems.
responsibilities: Perform intake or triage duties with minimal context
Learn system functionality in under 30 seconds
Operate system without formal training
Maintain workflow efficiency despite unfamiliarity
items.environment: Clinical setting, high-stress, no time for onboarding
